import pandas as pd
pd.set_option('display.max_rows', None)
from IPython.display import Markdown

Users       = pd.read_csv("../input/meta-kaggle/Users.csv")
Submissions = pd.read_csv("../input/meta-kaggle/Submissions.csv")

Users['RegisterDate'] = pd.to_datetime(Users['RegisterDate'])
Users['Year'] = Users['RegisterDate'].dt.year
n_users = Users.shape[0]

Submissions['SubmissionDate'] = pd.to_datetime(Submissions['SubmissionDate'])
Submissions['Year'] = Submissions['SubmissionDate'].dt.year
Submissions_in_2021 = Submissions.query("Year == 2021")

overlap = pd.merge(Users, Submissions_in_2021, how='inner', left_on=['Id'], right_on=['SubmittedUserId'])
n_active_veterans = overlap.UserName.nunique()

display(Markdown('### ' + f'{n_users:,}' + ' users joined kaggle since 2010, of which ' + f'{n_active_veterans:,}' + '  have participated in a competition in 2021:'))
# take a look
overlap.DisplayName.value_counts().to_frame(name="Number of submissions in 2021").head(500)
